hierarchy.entry_domain: NIST SP 800-53 Security and Privacy Controls

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a scenario where budget constraints limit storage, should an organization implement AU-4(1) transfer to alternate storage or risk overwriting logs? Debate the trade-offs using real-world breach examples like the SolarWinds incident where log availability was critical. Consider legal/compliance implications and peer responses.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST SP 800-53. Generate 15 high-quality flashcards on 'Audit storage capacity planning (AU-4)' in the topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Control Frameworks > NIST SP 800-53 > Audit and Accountability (AU) > AU-4. Incorporate these elements: - Learning objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM 'learning_objectives'] - Scaffolding: Build cards progressively from Layer 1 (foundation) to Layer 4 (integration). - Active learning: Draw from discussion (budget trade-offs, SolarWinds), peer teaching (calculations, misconceptions), problem-solving (500-user scenario). - Research context: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 AU-4 mandates sufficient storage for retention; supplemental guidance on log types; AU-4(1) transfer to alternate storage. Sources: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (nist.gov), CIS Controls v8. Use exact flashcard schema: [INSERT FULL 'flashcard_schema' DETAILS] Ensure pedagogical alignment: Cover all Bloom's levels, misconceptions (e.g., cloud eliminates planning, confuse with AU-9), prior links (AU-2/AU-3). Output ONLY as a numbered markdown list of flashcards, each with 'Front:' and 'Back:' sections. No intro/outro.
